description: Homemade taco seasoning is as simple as whisking together some pantry ingredients. Here's how to make the very best taco seasoning at home — and how to use it for tacos and beyond.
headline: How to Make Homemade Taco Seasoning

HowtoTip.text: Use: 3 tablespoons of this taco seasoning is equivilant to 1 package of taco seasoning. Storage: The seasoning keeps well in an airtight container at cool room temperature up to 6 months

name: How to Make Homemade Taco Seasoning

recipeInstructions.text: Measure out the spices into a medium bowl. Measure 1/4 cup sweet paprika, and 2 tablespoons each chili powder and dried oregano into a medium bowl. Add 1 tablespoon of each of the following: cornstarch, kosher salt, ground cumin, garlic powder, and onion powder. Add 1 teaspoon each of the following: granulated sugar, ground coriander, and black pepper.
Whisk the spices together. Whisk everything together, breaking up any clumps.

Use or store. If not using the spice mix immediately, transfer to an airtight container for long term storage at cool room temperature. 3 tablespoons of taco season will season 1 pound of ground beef, chicken, or tofu.

video.description:
Taco seasoning is a pantry essential, adding rich, spicy flavor to anything it touches. In addition to seasoning taco meat, it can be used a million different ways: as a dry brine for big cuts of meat, a seasoning for casseroles, and a flavor booster for chili, just to name a few. Making your own taco seasoning at home is as simple as whisking together some pantry ingredients. It gives you complete control over its flavor, tastes way better than anything that you can buy, and saves you from having to go to the store in the first place.

Here’s how to make the very best taco seasoning at home — and how to use it for tacos and beyond.

See full recipe [HERE](https://www.thekitchn.com/taco-seasoning-recipe-23023048)
video.name: How To Make the Best Taco Seasoning at Home
